climbs.name: Moose Illusion (open project)
climbs.fa: Thor Stewart, Scott Thorp, Etienne Lavigne, 2021

content.description:
When completed this will be a stellar line. For now, the first pitch is 50m; climbing a weakness in the base in a right facing wide cresent crack. It pulls a roof to eaiser slab climbing, up to a belay ledge, either make a trad anchor in a vertical crack here, or move right, out the the bolted rap station. There are a handful of bolts on route, one marks the start of the climb. 

Above this the route becomes a sustained crack right to the top for an estimated 4-ish pitches, although the FA team was thrawed by time concerns. 



This route is at the base of the tallest, biggest, baddest tower and aims towards the splitter crack system you can see from the highway. 

double rack to 4, one 5. some bolts, bolted rappel station.

Far away from the hustl'in and bust'lin of Whitehorse's busy Rock Gardens, lay an enitre hillside scattered with quality, limestone towers.  
 These towers are easily observed from the Klondike Highway directly across Poole Canyon, or just past the Conrad Camp ground. Identifable by looking up the valley between Escaprment Mountain and the old forest fire burn.  
 The towers are gaurded by a moat, Windy Arm. A short boat ride, or paddle (ski/sled/walk in the winter/spring) in calm conditions will see you across to the input of Ramshorn Creek.
